com.pump.io.location

Class IOLocation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pump.io.location.IOLocation
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ArchiveLocation, CachedLocation, Directory

    public abstract class IOLocation
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract representation for file systems, URLs, archives, search results, etc.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  IOLocation.Contains 
      static class  IOLocation.DeleteException
      This is used to indicate that deleting a location failed.
      static class  IOLocation.FileCreationException
      This is used to indicate that creating a file failed.
      static class  IOLocation.MakeDirectoryException
      This is used to indicate a call to mkdir or mkdirs failed.
      static class  IOLocation.MissingParentException
      This is used to indicate the parent of a location was expected and not available.
      static class  IOLocation.SetNameException
      This is used to indicate that changing the name of a location failed.

    • Field Detail

      • omitMacBundles

        public static boolean omitMacBundles
        This indicates that Mac bundles should not be navigable. For example: the file "Safari.app" is technically a directory, but because it ends with a bundle-identifying suffix (".app"): the method isNavigable() will (by default) return false.

      • FOLDER_ICON

        public static final javax.swing.Icon FOLDER_ICON

      • FILE_ICON

        public static final javax.swing.Icon FILE_ICON

    • Constructor Detail

      • IOLocation

        public IOLocation()

    • Method Detail

      • getPath

        public abstract java.lang.String getPath()
        This returns a unique path for this location. This could be used for sorting, hashtables, or otherwise uniquely identifying this object.

        Note this needs to uniquely the path, so different location types should include their unique prefixes. (a file-based location should start with something like "file://", and a ftp-based location should start with "ftp://", etc.)

      • flush

        public void flush()
        This flushes any cached information about this location. Some locations may cache several properties: the children, isHidden, exists, etc. This method should be called when we know that something has changed and all cached values should be purged.

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object t)
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • getName

        public abstract java.lang.String getName()
        This returns the file name of this location.

        This should be the end of getPath().

      • contains

        public IOLocation.Contains contains(java.lang.String name)
        Returns DOES_NOT_CONTAIN or CONTAINS_AS_DIRECTORY or CONTAINS_AS_FILE.

      • canWrite

        public abstract boolean canWrite()
        Returns true if this is a location you can write to. If this returns true, then directories should be able to call createDirectory() and createFile() and files should be able to call createOutputStream().

      • isDirectory

        public abstract boolean isDirectory()
        Returns true if this is a directory.

      • getParent

        public abstract IOLocation getParent()
        Returns the parent of this node.

      • getParentPath

        public java.lang.String getParentPath()
        Returns the parent path of this node.

        This should be equivalent to calling: getParent().getPath().

      • getTreePath

        public javax.swing.tree.TreePath getTreePath(boolean stringsOnly)
        Returns a TreePath of this node and all its parents.
        Parameters:
        stringsOnly - if true then the TreePath should contains String objects; if false then this should return IOLocation objects.

      • getChild

        public IOLocation getChild(java.lang.String name)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        This returns a reference to a child of this location. This may return null if this location cannot contain children (either because it is a file and not a directory, or because it is a directory that doesn't have write privileges).

        Also note that this can return a child that does not exist.

        The default implementation only polls existing children: subclasses are encouraged to override this to return locations that do not yet exist.

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the child.
        Returns:
        the child requested, or null.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IO problem occurs.

      • mkdir

        public abstract void mkdir()
                    throws java.io.IOException,
                           IOLocation.MakeDirectoryException
        Creates a directory at this location. This will throw an exception if a file already exists at this location.
        Throws:
        IOLocation.MakeDirectoryException - if an error occurs making a directory.
        java.io.IOException - if an IO problem occurs.

      • mkdirs

        public void mkdirs()
            throws java.io.IOException,
                   IOLocation.MakeDirectoryException
        Creates a directory at this location and creates all necessary parent directories.
        Throws:
        IOLocation.MakeDirectoryException - if an error occurs making a directory.
        java.io.IOException - if an IO problem occurs.

      • getURL

        public abstract java.net.URL getURL()
        If possible this will return a URL pointing to this location. This may return null if no such URL exists. (For example: a collection of search results is a directory of valid IOLocations that does not have a URL.)
        Returns:
        a URL to this location, if it exists.

      • listChildren

        public abstract IOLocation[] listChildren(Receiver<IOLocation> receiver,
                                          BasicCancellable cancellable)
        This lists the children of this directory.
        Parameters:
        receiver - an optional Receiver to be notified as each child is processed.
        cancellable - an optional Cancellable. If non-null: classes that extend this class should constantly poll it to see if isCancelled() is true.
        Returns:
        all the children (if any) of this object. This should not return null, but may return an empty array for non-directories.

      • getIcon

        public javax.swing.Icon getIcon(BasicCancellable cancellable)
        Returns the optional icon for this location. This may return null.
        Parameters:
        cancellable - it is crucial to call finish() on this object when this method finishes. Also you should constantly poll it to see if isCancelled() is true.
        Returns:
        the optional icon for this location.

      • getThumbnail

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getThumbnail(java.awt.Dimension maxSize,
                                                 Cancellable cancellable)
        Returns the optional thumbnail for this location. This may return null.
        Parameters:
        maxSize - the maximum size of this thumbnail. Preferably one of the dimensions of the returned image should match one of the dimensions of this argument. (that is, if you pass 128x128, the the width or height of the returned thumbnail should be 128)
        cancellable - it is crucial to call finish() on this object when this method finishes. Also you should constantly poll it to see if isCancelled() is true.
        Returns:
        the optional icon for this location.

      • getThumbnail

        protected BasicThumbnail getThumbnail()
        Return the BasicThumbnail to apply to thumbnails.

      • createDirectoryThumbnail

        protected java.awt.image.BufferedImage createDirectoryThumbnail(java.awt.Dimension size,
                                                                Cancellable cancellable)
        Returns a thumbnail composed of smaller thumbnails.
        Parameters:
        size - the size this thumbnail will be.
        cancellable - an optional cancellable.
        Returns:
        a thumbnail, or null if the smaller thumbnails that are required were not found.

      • createUnframedThumbnail

        protected java.awt.image.BufferedImage createUnframedThumbnail(java.awt.Dimension maxSize)

      • getExtension

        public java.lang.String getExtension()
        Return the file extension of this resource, or null if it does not exist (as will often be the case for directories).

      • setName

        public abstract IOLocation setName(java.lang.String s)
                            throws java.io.IOException,
                                   IOLocation.SetNameException
        This changes the name of this location. If there are resources currently at this location: those resources should be moved if getName().equals(s) is false and no exceptions occur.

        This method is not capable of moving a resource to another directory structure.

        Parameters:
        s - the name name of this resource.
        Returns:
        the new IOLocation the resource formerly at this location can now be accessed from.
        Throws:
        IOLocation.SetNameException - if an error occurred renaming this file.
        java.io.IOException - if an IO problem occurs.

      • createInputStream

        public abstract java.io.InputStream createInputStream()
                                               throws java.io.IOException
        Creates an InputStream to read from this location -- if possible.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IO problem occurs.

      • createOutputStream

        public abstract java.io.OutputStream createOutputStream()
                                                 throws java.io.IOException,
                                                        IOLocation.FileCreationException
        Creates an OutputStream to write to this location -- if possible.
        Throws:
        IOLocation.FileCreationException - if an error occurred creating this resource.
        java.io.IOException - if an IO problem occurs.

      • length

        public abstract long length()
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the size of this resource.
        Returns:
        the size of this resource, or zero if it does not exist.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - a generic exception related to this operation.

      • delete

        public abstract void delete()
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            IOLocation.DeleteException
        Deletes the resources at this location.
        Throws:
        IOLocation.DeleteException - an exception related to deleting.
        java.io.IOException - a generic exception related to this operation.

      • exists

        public abstract boolean exists()
        Indicates whether this resource exists.

        Generally IOLocation objects are hard to come across if they aren't associated with a resource, but if you delete or rename a location successfully this will return false.

        Returns:
        true if this location represents a resource that exists.

      • getModificationDate

        public abstract long getModificationDate()
                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Returns:
        the last modified time (in milliseconds) of this resource.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - a generic exception related to this operation.

      • isHidden

        public abstract boolean isHidden()
        Indicates if this resource is visible to the user.
        Returns:
        true if this resource is hidden from the user.

      • isAlias

        public boolean isAlias()
        Indicates whether this resource is an alias or not.
        Returns:
        true if this resource is an alias.

      • isNavigable

        public boolean isNavigable()
        This indicates if the user is encouraged to navigate inside this location.

        For example, on Macs certain folders end in ".app". Although technically these are directories, users shouldn't navigate inside them.

        Also: archive files (like the ZipArchiveLocation) are a file (and not a directory), but they are navigable.

        By default this returns isDirectory(), but if omitMacBundles is true this will return false if this location's name ends with a suffix like ".app".

        Returns:
        true if this resource is a directory that should be navigable.
        See Also:
        omitMacBundles

      • isDefaultNavigable

        protected static boolean isDefaultNavigable(IOLocation loc)
        This indicates if the user is encouraged to navigate inside this location by default.
        See Also:
        omitMacBundles

      • canRead

        public abstract boolean canRead()
        If this returns true then createInputStream() should return successfully.
        Returns:
        true if this is a resource you have permission to read.

      • getGroup

        public IOLocationGroup getGroup()
        This may return a group shared between related IOLocations. For example: if this location is accessed via a connection with a name and password, then all related locations should return the same object. When the user switches to a location in a different group: then the former group's dispose() method is called.

        This may return null if the IOLocationGroup is not necessary.

        Returns:
        a IOLocationGroup for this resource
